ðŸŒŸ surge | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: A versatile and high-performance download manager for terminal-based workflows, automation, and background server tasks.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ High-speed Downloads with multi-connection support â€¢ Beautiful TUI built with Bubble Tea & Lipgloss â€¢ Pause/Resume downloads seamlessly â€¢ Real-time Progress with speed graphs and ETA â€¢ Auto-retry on connection failures
ðŸ“– Summary: Surge is a high-speed, open-source download manager built in Go, offering a versatile experience through its Terminal User Interface (TUI), Headless Server mode, and Command Line Interface (CLI) capabilities. It is designed for efficient file downloads with features like multi-connection support, pause/resume, and real-time progress monitoring.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ fclones-gui | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Finding and removing duplicate files through an interactive graphical interface.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Identifying groups of identical files â€¢ Finding duplicate files â€¢ Scanning multiple directory roots â€¢ Filtering names and paths by extended UNIX globs â€¢ Filtering by min/max file size
ðŸ“– Summary: fclones-gui is an interactive graphical user interface for the fclones command-line tool, designed to help users find and remove duplicate files efficiently. It offers features for identifying identical files across multiple directories, with advanced filtering options, and provides flexible methods for removing or replacing duplicates, including support for copy-on-write file systems.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ Singularity | C
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To provide advanced stealth and evasion capabilities within a Linux kernel environment, primarily for security research, penetration testing, or demonstrating kernel-level vulnerabilities.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Process Hiding â€¢ File & Directory Hiding â€¢ Network Stealth â€¢ Privilege Escalation â€¢ Log Sanitization
ðŸ“– Summary: Singularity is a stealthy Linux Kernel Module (LKM) rootkit for modern 6.x kernels, utilizing ftrace for advanced system call hooking. It offers comprehensive features for hiding processes, files, and network connections, alongside capabilities for privilege escalation, log sanitization, and evasion of various detection mechanisms like eBPF tools and EDRs.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ superlinker | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Creating self-contained, dependency-free ELF executables by merging multiple libraries and the dynamic linker into a single binary.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Combines ELF executables and shared libraries into larger products â€¢ Lifts ELF ET_DYN objects into an intermediate representation â€¢ Lowers intermediate representation back to an ELF ET_DYN object
ðŸ“– Summary: Superlinker is a Rust tool that reinterprets and combines ELF executables and shared libraries into larger, self-contained binaries. It functions like a compiler for interpreted programs, lifting ELF objects into an intermediate representation and lowering them back, enabling the merging of dynamic linkers and dependencies into a single executable.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ Allegro | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Generating short, high-quality videos from textual descriptions and optionally initial image frames.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Text-to-Video generation â€¢ Text-Image-to-Video generation (Allegro-TI2V) â€¢ Generates 6-second videos at 15 FPS and 720p resolution â€¢ Open-sourced models available on Hugging Face â€¢ Integration with Hugging Face diffusers library
ðŸ“– Summary: Allegro is a Python-based text-to-video generation model capable of producing up to 6-second videos at 720p resolution and 15 FPS from text prompts. A variant, Allegro-TI2V, extends this by incorporating first-frame and optional last-frame image inputs.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ vulnhuntr | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Automated discovery of zero-day vulnerabilities in Python projects using AI and static code analysis.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Zero-shot vulnerability discovery using LLMs â€¢ Identifies complex, multi-step vulnerabilities â€¢ Analyzes code call chains from user input to server output â€¢ Supports Python codebases â€¢ Detects vulnerability classes: LFI, AFO, RCE, XSS, SQLI, SSRF, IDOR
ðŸ“– Summary: Vulnhuntr is a Python tool that uses Large Language Models (LLMs) combined with static code analysis to discover complex, multi-step, remotely exploitable vulnerabilities in Python codebases. It aims to find zero-day vulnerabilities that traditional static analysis tools might miss by analyzing entire code call chains from user input to server output.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source
